channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023110396
item.description:
Report X-2023110396

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A LOADER PICKED UP THE PACKAGE IN A TRAILER AND NOTICED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID COMING FROM THE CORNER OF THE BOX. EMPLOYEE NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR, WHO NOTIFIED THE RESPONDER. RESPONDER REFERRED TO THE CORROSIVE OXIDIZER RESPONSE SHEETS. RESPONDER REMOVED PACKAGE FROM TRAILER AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023110614
item.description:
Report E-2023110614

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: MONROE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 20, 2023, one (1) 55-gallond drum containing UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the sulfuric acid solution-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and excess debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110901
item.description:
Report X-2023110901

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon arriving to the QA cage, a hazmat was found leaking. Package was brought into the hazmat cage for inspection. During inspection it was found one jug had a loose vented cap that was the cause of the leakage. After inspection was finished jugs and outer package were placed into a salvage drum to prevent further leakage. DescribePack: Failure was caused by one vented cap leaking from one of the jugs. cap was tightened back to the jug and placed into a drum to prevent further leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent further vaper and leakage.

  • Description: approximately 1 quart of SC2000 Black Cement (non-flammable) was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture to the lower side of the drum. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was contacted to assist with cleanup of material.

  • Description: (2) (5) gallon metal pails and (1) (1) gallon metal pail was damaged arrived damaged due to no dunnage used/unprotected freight inside of trailer. (2) G released in total of CEVA M Coating. Spill was contained and cleaned. All materials were placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110620
item.description:
Report X-2023110620

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED AT QA AND THE BOTTOM WAS VISIBLEY WET ON ONE CORNER/BOTTOM OF BOX. WHEN PACKAGE WAS PLACED AT QA NO OTHER INFO WAS GIVEN TO ME REGARDIN HOW THIS HAPPENED OR WHEN. DescribePack: 1 OF THE 4 JUGS INSIDE THE BOX WAS PUNCTURED AT SOME POINT DURING THE SORT, CAUSING THE LIQUID TO LEAK OUT INTO BOX. VERY SMALL HOLE SO THE LEAK WAS A SLOW LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS SECURED AWAY FROM THE DOCK IN A YELLOW HAZMAT TUB AND INVESTIGATED AS DAMAGED. THE 1 JUG WAS PUT ON ITS SIDE TO PREVENT ANY MORE LIQUID LEAKING OUT.

item.title: Report E-2023110404
item.description:
Report E-2023110404

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 5-gallon release of regulated UN1760 "Miramar MM150" was released at Terminal NWN. It was stated that (1) a 275-gallon plastic tote was punctured by a forklift at the top of its container during unloading operations impacting the Trailer. The terminal personnel shifted the IBC tote to its side until the contractor's arrival. All impacted surfaces were cleaned and wiped. All material contained in the damaged tote was transferred to a new one and all labels were transferred. The new tote will continue to its destination. All waste and the damaged tote have been containerized for disposal. (3) 55 DF 55G DF- Damaged tote / Pads were created and left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110483
item.description:
Report X-2023110483

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded off the trailer. It was found that the package was leaking out and the contents had soiled the package. The package and all it is contents were found. They were put all together. The package was put in a HAZMAT bag and then a drum. It was brought up to be processed. DescribePack: The caps were loose on all of the bottles. There is a crack on one of the jugs at the inside of the handle. This jug has leaked out the most. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package and the contents were brought out. They were put together and put in a HAZMAT plastic bag. Then the package was put in a plastic hazmat barrel and brought out to be processed.
